qas.question: What group did Paul VI address in New York in 1965?
Who was the first pope to visit the United States?
To whom did Paul VI give a diamond cross and ring in hopes it would raise funds to help people globally?
What did Paul VI ask the UN to promote during the Vietnam war?
What US president was in office when Paul VI visited America for the first time?

context: <a1_0>Pope Paul VI<a1_0/> became the first reigning pontiff ever to visit the Americas when he flew to New York in October 1965 to address the <a0_0><a2_0>United Nations<a2_0/><a0_0/>. As a gesture of goodwill, the pope gave to the UN two pieces of papal jewelry, a diamond cross and ring, with the hopes that the proceeds from their sale at auction would contribute to the UN's efforts to end human suffering. During the pope's visit, as the U.S. involvement in the Vietnam War escalated under <a4_0>President Johnson<a4_0/>, Paul VI pleaded for <a3_0>peace<a3_0/> before the UN:
